description: Fixed a couple of typos. On measure 83, let chord fade. On measure 99, make sure to cut off note.
title: The Rover

description: Further reworking of Page’s distortion guitar (Guitar 1) to measure 120. Notes – Measure 10) Pull off is more a lift off. Measures 33 and 52) Staccato like. Measures 68 – 83) The bridge is eight repeats of a two -measure phrase. I play the high C#’s as ghost notes. Measure 102) Play notes distinctly. Listen to the recording to get a better feel of the short rests/stops and staccato like picking. I’m guessing Page played this loosely on stage. Be slinky – enjoy!
title: The Rover

description: This is an alternate TAB for Guitar 1 (Page’s distortion guitar) for Led Zeppelin’s The Rover. The bass, solo and fills overdriven guitar, and drum tracks have not been changed from the 6/30/2009 version by ruvik or the 3/13/20 version by Jax Joke. I used the 1993 Remaster as the reference recording; and used on-line tutorials (available on YouTube as of 03/21/2020) from Howard Hart, Las Vegas Guitar, GuitarLessons365Song and James James. I reworked the intro, verse and chorus parts up to measure #120. Some of the notes from the original ruvik TAB were simply wrong; I think the bends and the harmonic overtones can really trick the ear. The update by Jax Joke fixed some of that; however, I felt more could be done. I think the tutorials from Howard Heart and Las Vegas Guitar are more accurate for this particular track. Basically, what I did was make mods to this TAB based on their TABS, then listened to the remaster to make sure as best possible that what I was writing was accurate.
title: The Rover

description: It should be good.. not my tab.. I just modified some bars of the main riff..
title: The Rover
